intro: Dyera lowii, commonly known as the Malayan dyera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. Dyera lowii is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the study of tropical flora.
